intro: Parietaria microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved wall-rocket, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found growing along walls and in rocky areas. Parietaria microphylla is known for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
